intro: Anarrhinum lusitanicum, commonly known as the Lusitanian thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny, lobed leaves and purple to pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. It has a compact growth habit and produces small, hard seeds that are dispersed by wind. Anarrhinum lusitanicum is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands.
